cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the north-central Gulf toward southeastern Louisiana, then turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Houma

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the port; hurricane watches east of Intracoastal City
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA (includes Lake Charles area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast from Sabine Pass eastward to the Mississippi River delta, with greatest impacts southeast of the port
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (sustained 40–45 mph, higher gusts) late Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible for Sabine Pass to Pecan Island, including the Calcasieu Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain in bands, locally higher amounts, producing urban and poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands, rough seas in Calcasieu Lake and approaches, minor river rises.
